verses.text: Amaziah \add was\add* twenty and five years old \add when\add* he began to reign , and he reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name \add was\add* Jehoaddan of Jerusalem.
And he did \add that which was\add* right in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, but not with a perfect heart. \p
¶ Now it came to pass, when the kingdom was established to him, that he slew his servants that had killed the king his father.\f + \fr 25.3 \ft established…: Heb. confirmed upon him\f*

But he slew not their children , but \add did\add* as \add it is\add* written in the law in the book of Moses , where the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* commanded , saying , The fathers shall not die for the children , neither shall the children die for the fathers , but every man shall die for his own sin. \p

¶ Moreover Amaziah gathered Judah together , and made them captains over thousands , and captains over hundreds , according to the houses of \add their\add* fathers , throughout all Judah and Benjamin : and he numbered them from twenty years old and above , and found them three hundred thousand choice \add men, able\add* to go forth to war , that could handle spear and shield.
He hired also an hundred thousand mighty men of valour out of Israel for an hundred talents of silver.

But there came a man of God to him, saying , O king , let not the army of Israel go with thee; for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* not with Israel , \add to wit, with\add* all the children of Ephraim.
But if thou wilt go , do \add it\add*, be strong for the battle : God shall make thee fall before the enemy : for God hath power to help , and to cast down.

And Amaziah said to the man of God , But what shall we do for the hundred talents which I have given to the army of Israel ? And the man of God answered , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* is able to give thee much more than this.\f + \fr 25.9 \ft army: Heb. band\f*

Then Amaziah separated them, \add to wit\add*, the army that was come to him out of Ephraim , to go home again : wherefore their anger was greatly kindled against Judah , and they returned home in great anger.\f + \fr 25.10 \ft home again: Heb. to their place\f*\f + \fr 25.10 \ft in great…: Heb. in heat of anger\f* \p
¶ And Amaziah strengthened himself, and led forth his people , and went to the valley of salt , and smote of the children of Seir ten thousand.

And \add other\add* ten thousand \add left\add* alive did the children of Judah carry away captive , and brought them unto the top of the rock , and cast them down from the top of the rock , that they all were broken in pieces. \p

¶ But the soldiers of the army which Amaziah sent back , that they should not go with him to battle , fell upon the cities of Judah , from Samaria even unto Beth-horon , and smote three thousand of them, and took much spoil.\f + \fr 25.13 \ft the soldiers…: Heb. the sons of the band\f* \p

¶ Now it came to pass, after that Amaziah was come from the slaughter of the Edomites , that he brought the gods of the children of Seir , and set them up \add to be\add* his gods , and bowed down himself before them, and burned incense unto them.

Wherefore the anger of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was kindled against Amaziah , and he sent unto him a prophet , which said unto him, Why hast thou sought after the gods of the people , which could not deliver their own people out of thine hand ?

And it came to pass, as he talked with him, that \add the king\add* said unto him, Art thou made of the king’s counsel ? forbear ; why shouldest thou be smitten ? Then the prophet forbare , and said , I know that God hath determined to destroy thee, because thou hast done this, and hast not hearkened unto my counsel.\f + \fr 25.16 \ft determined: Heb. counselled\f* \p
¶ Then Amaziah king of Judah took advice , and sent to Joash , the son of Jehoahaz , the son of Jehu , king of Israel , saying , Come , let us see one another in the face.

And Joash king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah , saying , The thistle that \add was\add* in Lebanon sent to the cedar that \add was\add* in Lebanon , saying , Give thy daughter to my son to wife : and there passed by a wild beast that \add was\add* in Lebanon , and trode down the thistle.\f + \fr 25.18 \ft thistle: or, furze bush, or, thorn\f*\f + \fr 25.18 \ft a wild…: Heb. a beast of the field\f*

Thou sayest , Lo, thou hast smitten the Edomites ; and thine heart lifteth thee up to boast : abide now at home ; why shouldest thou meddle to \add thine\add* hurt , that thou shouldest fall , \add even\add* thou, and Judah with thee?
But Amaziah would not hear ; for it \add came\add* of God , that he might deliver them into the hand \add of their enemies\add*, because they sought after the gods of Edom.
So Joash the king of Israel went up ; and they saw one another in the face , \add both\add* he and Amaziah king of Judah , at Beth-shemesh , which \add belongeth\add* to Judah.
And Judah was put to the worse before Israel , and they fled every man to his tent.\f + \fr 25.22 \ft put…: Heb. smitten\f*

And Joash the king of Israel took Amaziah king of Judah , the son of Joash , the son of Jehoahaz , at Beth-shemesh , and brought him to Jerusalem , and brake down the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim to the corner gate , four hundred cubits.\f + \fr 25.23 \ft the corner…: Heb. the gate of it that looketh\f*

And \add he took\add* all the gold and the silver , and all the vessels that were found in the house of God with Obed-edom , and the treasures of the king’s house , the hostages also, and returned to Samaria. \p
¶ And Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah lived after the death of Joash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel fifteen years.
Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah , first and last , behold, \add are\add* they not written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel ? \p

¶ Now after the time that Amaziah did turn away from following the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* they made a conspiracy against him in Jerusalem ; and he fled to Lachish : but they sent to Lachish after him, and slew him there.\f + \fr 25.27 \ft from…: Heb. from after\f*\f + \fr 25.27 \ft made…: Heb. conspired a conspiracy\f*
And they brought him upon horses , and buried him with his fathers in the city of Judah.\f + \fr 25.28 \ft Judah: that is, the city of David\f*
